description: Construction of a detached two storey dwellinghouse with excavation of lower ground floor; associated car parking, cycle parking and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 10331/L02/C (site location plan)

10331/74/C (floor plans); 10331/E09/B (proposed front & SE elevations); 10331/E10/C (proposed rear & NW elevations); 10331/S06/A (longitudinal cross section) Arboricultural Impact Assessment dated 5th Sept2018; ARD1350: Preliminary Ecological Appraisal dated 5th Sept 2018

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, further details of all external materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing prior to commencement of the works. In particular, the colour of bricks, permeable paving, roofing material, balustrades, fenestration and any means of enclosure and outside lighting to the frontage.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the  recommendations of the approved Preliminary Ecological Appraisal dated 05 Sept 2018, a planting plan and schedule  for biodiverse soft landscaping to the front and rear of the new house, including the proposed green roof, shall be submitted to and approved in writing prior to occupation of the development. Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity and biodiversity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development  in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and Draft Policy G5 of the Draft New London Plan(2020), the London Environment strategy (2018) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, details for surface water drainage design and a detailed maintenance plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the council in accordance with the following criteria:
(i) The drainage system must be designed to control runoff up to a 1 in 100 year storm event.
(ii) The rate at which surface water is discharged from the site may vary with the severity of the storm event but must not exceed the greenfield runoff rate for a given storm event.
(iii) Excess surface water runoff must be stored on site and released to receiving watercourses at greenfield rates.
(iv) Surface water discharges to watercourses must not have greater velocity than 1 m/s.

Submitted details shall also include a site specific ground investigation with accompanying engineering drawings and borehole scan results; a ground investigation with sketched structural details which specify the depth and arrangement of foundations; an assessment of basement (lower ground floor) impacts on drainage with flooding from all sources (surface water and ground water impacts); ground water conditions and structural stability where appropriate shall be included to ensure the development does not result in flooding or ground instability.

Reason: To ensure the development does not result in flooding or ground instability and for rea and sons of sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.3 and 5.12 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 1.1 of Ealing's Development Strategy (2026) and policies 5.12 and EA of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019)

| A detailed Construction Method Statement (including the construction of the basement/lower ground floor) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before the development is commenced. The statement shall include details of phasing and programming, removal of earth from site; construction methods; site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications and numbers/frequency of vehicles/deliveries, construction worker parking, anticipated number, delivery times, dust suppression measures, site security, vehicle manoeuvring and turning, locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices, procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents, measures to ensure the construction process does not effect of neighbouring highways, details of wheel water spraying facilities and noise/vibration mitigation measures. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, a Service Waste Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to demonstrate the facility for the collection of household recyclable and non-recyclable waste  in accordance with council collection times, for the development.

Reason: To ensure the properly managed collection of domestic waste in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD  (2013) and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016). | Prior to occupation of the scheme  hereby approved, further details for outdoor lighting to the frontage of the new dwelling shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

Reason: To safeguard pedestrians and vehicles using the access lane and to protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the development  in accordance with policies 7.4 and EA of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), London Plan (2016)  policies 7.4 and 7.6 and policy D4 the New Draft London Plan (2019)
| Prior to first occupation of the new house, an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh shall be installed and thereafter permanently retained
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).
| No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A  and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A to F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 and to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no extensions or works as specified in the stated classed shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Furthermore, at no time shall the new house be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | At least 4 secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and retained thereafter
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2016) policy 6.9 and table 6.3
| Discreet waste and recycling storage facilities to accommodate at least 2x 240L bins for recycling and non-recycling shall be provided and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development  in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013)
